src:
Anny Pandini Waspadai Pejudo Filipina
07 Nov 2019, 09:46 by Ni Putu Nirawati


Anny Pandini Waspadai Pejudo Filipina

KBRN, Denpasar: Multi event olahraga bergengsi antar Negara di Kawasan Asia Tenggara tinggal menghitung hari. Berlokasi di Manila Filipina, Sea Games 2019 akan dimulai 30 November hingga 11 Desember mendatang dengan estimasi keterlibatan partisipan mencapai 9 ribu 840 atlet.
Berbagai persiapan dilaksanakan para atlet di Tanah Air menjelang tampil di Filipina. Salah satunya dari cabang olahraga judo. Dihubungi RRI di sela-sela latihan di Padepokan Judo Ciloto Jawa Barat Kamis, (7/11/2019) Pejudo kebanggaan Bali Kadek Anny Pandini  mengaku sudah berlatih keras demi ajang Sea Games kali ini.
Tahun 2017 lalu ia kehilangan kesempatan membela Merah Putih, lantaran pada Sea Games 2017 kelas   -57 kg putri tidak dipertandingkan. Oleh karenanya Anny bertekad mengulang kesuksesannya pada Sea Games 2015, dimana kala itu ia berhasil mempersembahkan medali emas untuk Merah Putih.
“Program latihan kali ini berbeda dengan latihan sebelumnya. Di Pelatnas menyesuaikan jadwal latihan dengan pertandingan nanti di sana. Kita membiasakan diri latihan untuk menghadapi pertandingan siang nantinya”, tuturnya.
Pejudo kelahiran 10 Mei 1993 itu lebih lanjut menuturkan, menjelang keberangkatan yang tinggal beberapa hari lagi, untuk latihan fisik sudah lebih ringan dari bulan-bulan sebelumnya. Para pelatih mengarahkan atlet untuk mematangkan teknik serta strategi.
“Latihan itu sekarang lebih ke teknik, latihan fisiknya sudah diakumulasikan dengan latihan teknik judo”, ucapnya.
Anggota Korps Wanita Angkatan Darat (Kowad) Jasdam IX/Udayana itu juga selalu mengucap syukur karena di tengah latihan ketat selama di Pelatnas, dukungan keluarga terus mengalir, sehingga hal itu menjadi motivasi dan penyemangat untuk tampil maksimal di Filipina.
Terkait lawan berat, menurut Anny dirinya harus mewaspadai pejudo tuan rumah Filipina, mengingat pada Sea Games kali ini mereka banyak menggunakan pemain naturalisasi dari Jepang.
Untuk dikehui selain Anny Pandini, Bali juga menyumbangkan tiga pejudo lainnya di Pelatnas Sea Games yakni Gede Ganding, Dewa Ayu Mira Widari, dan Agastya. Sebelumnya juga tercatat nama pejudo Fania Farid di Pelatnas, namun dikarenakan harus fokus kuliah, Fania memutuskan hengkang dari Pelatnas.
text:
Anny Pandini Beware of Pejudo Philippines
Nov 7 2019, 09:46 by Ni Putu Nirawati


Anny Pandini Beware of Pejudo Philippines

KBRN, Denpasar: Multi prestigious sports events between countries in the Southeast Asian Region are just a matter of days. Located in Manila Philippines, the 2019 Sea Games will begin November 30 to December 11 with an estimated involvement of 9,000 840 athletes.
Various preparations carried out by athletes in the country ahead of appearing in the Philippines. One of them is from the judo sport. Contacted by RRI on the sidelines of the training at Padepokan Judo Ciloto, West Java Thursday, (11/07/2019) Pejudo's pride in Bali, Kadek Anny Pandini, claimed to have trained hard for the Sea Games event this time.
In 2017 he lost the opportunity to defend the Red and White, because at the 2017 Sea Games the women's 57-kg class was not competed. Therefore Anny was determined to repeat her success at the 2015 Sea Games, where at that time she managed to present a gold medal for Merah Putih.
"This training program is different from the previous training. In Pelatnas adjust the training schedule with the match later there. We will get used to training to face the midday match ", he said.
Pejudo, who was born on May 10, 1993, further said, before the departure that was only a few days away, physical exercise was lighter than in previous months. Trainers direct athletes to develop techniques and strategies.
"The training is now more technical, the physical training has been accumulated with judo technical training", he said.
Members of the Women's Army Corps (Kowad) Jasdam IX / Udayana also always give thanks because in the midst of rigorous training while at Pelatnas, family support continues to flow, so that it becomes motivation and encouragement to perform optimally in the Philippines.
Related to heavy opponents, according to Anny, he must be aware of the host of the Philippines host judges, considering that at this Sea Games they use a lot of naturalized players from Japan.
In addition to Anny Pandini, Bali also donated three other judges at the Pelatnas Sea Games namely Gede Ganding, Dewa Ayu Mira Widari, and Agastya. Previously it was also recorded the name of pejudo Fania Farid in Pelatnas, but due to having to focus on college, Fania decided to leave the Pelatnas.
